54934.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6eem0","text":"Gather reagents for immunostaining, noting that steps 9-11, 15, and 17-18 can be performed in Kartell staining chambers (each holds ~50 mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dub69","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"pfib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":123}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34r0e","text":"Always use freshly-made antibody and wash buffers (steps 4, 6); other reagents can be prepared ahead of time and stored at  .","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D59AD7E0523211ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bhee","text":"Acquire images of stained pancreas sections using a high-resolution whole slide scanning system (Aperio ScanScope FL, Leica Biosystems). An example field of view is shown below in Figure 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb4kv","text":"Let the frozen cryosections thaw at room temperature and air-dry for about  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"com46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed6or","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"C7D76FFF521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1ps3","text":"To remove OCT, wash slides 3 times in 1X PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"E2F98C46521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erpgs","text":"Permeabilize the tissue section with permeabilization solution for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"E85956D9521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g0cv","text":"Wash the sections 3 times in 1X PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"EC7000BB521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8h8bb","text":"Draw rectangles around the sections with PAP pen and let them dry for about  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"F101B988521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4viq0","text":"Block the sections with blocking buffer at room temperature for   in a humidified chamber. Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"F5545F84521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajks2","text":"Aspirate the blocking buffer, add primary antibodies diluted in antibody buffer (see Table 1), and incubate in a humidified chamber   at  . Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with antibody solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"687v7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ks14","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar18r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"FC3F9D32521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"03DF5360523311ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"FC3FA004521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","height":145,"id":190058,"is_video":false,"label":"","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":67,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aalhh","text":"Table 1: Detailed information for primary and secondary antibodies.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"Picture1.jpg","pause":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vnbnyjx.jpg","preset":["overnight"],"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vkbnyjx.jpg","start":null,"type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vmbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vjbnyjx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hn5t","text":"Aspirate the primary antibody solution and wash the sections 3 times in wash buffer for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"0518154E521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fq9c","text":"Add secondary antibodies diluted in antibody buffer (see Table 1) and incubate for   at room temperature in a humidified chamber. Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with antibody solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"09AF1343521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97a0e","text":"Aspirate the secondary antibody solution and incubate slides in DAPI solution to counterstain for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"11DA20E4521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48pit","text":"Wash slides 3 times in 1x PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"17CE3914521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j44e","text":"Add a sufficient volume of SlowFade Gold mounting medium (approximately 5-10 µl) to each tissue section, ensuring tissue section will be entirely covered after medium spreads. Carefully mount coverslips, making sure to avoid creating air bubbles between the tissue and coverslip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dst1l","text":"Blot away any excess mounting medium from slide edges and seal the coverslipped slides with nail polish on all edges. Allow slides to dry completely before imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lcto","text":"Apply a tissue classifier algorithm (HALO® image analysis platform, Indica Labs) to quantify cross-sectional area of islet alpha (glucagon+), beta (insulin+), and delta (somatostatin+) cells. An example markup image is shown in Figure 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":228,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab7k0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47tp5","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adjnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7arih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"531573CC521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","height":327.99999999999994,"id":190062,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":22,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2kg0a","text":"Figure 1 (above left). Fluorescent imaging of mouse pancreatic tissue.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":23,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"46ds6","text":"Figure 2 (above right). Analysis of mouse pancreatic islets using a tissue classifier algorithm.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"Picture2.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vsbnyjx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vqbnyjx.jpg","type":1,"url":"https://indicalab.com/products/tissue-classification/","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vrbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vpbnyjx.webp","width":543.3734939759036}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":48,"offset":74,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2ilru","text":"To quantify islet cell mass for a given mouse, stain and analyze at least 5 cryosections spaced approximately 200 μm apart.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2n7ac","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53keh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cnk46","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1jka4","text":"Each islet cell type is reported as a percentage of total alpha, beta, and delta cell area. Islet cell mass is calculated by multiplying alpha, beta, and/or delta cell area by pancreas weight.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"6F5D9A80524111ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","height":179.44164759725396,"id":190066,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":"step-4AB4FD60521C11EC84A8739F0BC5FEC7-nested-draft-adjnc","original_name":"IPA-protocols-20.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vwbnyjx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vubnyjx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vvbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vtbnyjx.webp","width":145.48423005565866},"mutability":"","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0r14","text":"10% Triton X-100 stock (30 mL) – Combine 3 mL Triton-X-100 and 27 mL 1X PBS. Mix on shaker for   or until Triton X-100 is completely dissolved. Store at   for up to 1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":153,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B51DFDEE523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B51DFC7E523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k7ct","text":"Permeabilization solution (0.2% Triton, 50 mL) – Combine 1 mL 10% Triton stock and 49 mL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6deea","text":"Blocking buffer (5% Normal Donkey Serum, 4 mL) – Combine 0.2 mL NDS and 3.8 mL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p0ci","text":"Antibody buffer (10 mL) – Combine 0.1 g BSA, 0.1 mL 10% Triton stock, and 9.8 mL 1X PBS. Filter solution through a 0.22 μm syringe filter and store at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":151,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CBD1B915523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vnmr","text":"DAPI staining solution (1:25,000, 50 mL) – Combine 2 µl DAPI stock (5mg/mL) and 50 mL 1X PBS. Keep protected from light or prepare right before step 17.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aif15","text":"Wash buffer (150 mL) - Combine 148.5 mL 1X PBS and 1.5 mL 10% Triton X-100 stock.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9dac","text":"This SOP defines the method used by the Vanderbilt Diabetes Center Islet and Pancreas Analysis (IPA) Core for fixation and embedding of mouse pancreas.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: phosphate, dibasic (Na2HPO4), Sigma #9952949","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lkg0","text":"Xylazine, Henry Schein #50-363-579","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38u8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u1q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bnno","text":"Supplies mm tissue culture dishes, Fisher Scientific #08-772-32 or similar","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bm38","text":"15 mL conical tubes, Corning #430828 or similar","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdb69","text":"Cryomolds, VWR #25608-916 or #1518848","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23j4o","text":"Forceps, Roboz # RS-8254 or status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"101ug","text":"Ketamine (15 mg/mL)/xylazine (3 mg/mL) working solution – Use 5 mL syringes with 18G needles. Label all bottles with additive, mix date, and expiration date of earliest-expiring ingredient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fa5d1","text":"Pull 2 mL of xylazine and inject into a 10 mL bottle of ketamine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c63b","text":"Pull 2 mL of ketamine/xylazine and inject into a 10 mL bottle of saline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vjst","text":"Inject mice intraperitoneally with ketamine/xylazine solution (1 μl/mg body weight) using a 1 mL syringe with a 27G needle. Place mice into a plastic bin with air holes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj4mc","text":"After 5-10 minutes, check to see if mice are fully anesthetized bygently pinching feet and tail. If there is a jerking or squeaking response, inject about 100 μL more of ketamine/xylazine solution, and wait a few more minutes. Continue checking for full anesthetization before beginning surgery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s4r2","text":"Coat a labeled cryomold with a thin layer of OCT compound and set aside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duejk","text":"0.1 M PBS (1L) – Dissolve 12.07 g Na2HPO4 (dibasic), 8.0 g NaCl, and 2.0 g KCl in 1L Milli-Q water.  This solution should be made fresh or can be sterile filtered, kept at  , and used within 1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"sub","offset":36,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":40,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":172,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dkvma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"10A264C0524211ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ee0uu","text":"4% Paraformaldehyde (PFA) – Dilute one ampule (10 mL) 16% PFA in 30 mL 0.1M PBS. This solution should be made fresh the day of fixation. Approximately 13mL per pancreas is required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cupnj","text":"30% Sucrose – Dissolve 15 g sucrose in 35mL 10 mM PBS. Solution can be placed on shaker to ensure sucrose fully dissolves.  Approximately 13 mL per pancreas is required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dke14","text":"Pipet 13 mL aliquots into labeled 15 mL conical tubes (one per pancreas). Using analytical balance, record weight of each tube to nearest 0.01 g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jbtl","text":"Place mouse face up on the surgical stage, tape limbs down, and wipe with 70% ethanol. Open the body cavity using forceps and scissors and locate pancreas by moving stomach and intestines to the side. Use two pairs of forceps to separate the pancreas from the duodenum and stomach, starting from the head. Remove the pancreas with the spleen still attached.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"114ba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amkba","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2a9v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ni0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EF08A390524311ECBAD01B75804472DC","height":309,"id":190084,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2dr65","text":"Above left: Pancreas location relative to other internal organs.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4797v","text":"Above right: Pancreas tail attaches to spleen; pancreas head attaches to duodenum.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IPA-protocols-21.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wgbnyjx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3webnyjx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wfbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wdbnyjx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3680p","text":"Place the pancreas in a 100 mm tissue culture dish containing 10 mL ice-cold 10 mM PBS. Dissect away the spleen and remove all fat tissue attached to pancreas.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b44o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"22t0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5nf68","text":"If there is excess bleeding during dissection, rinse pancreas in an additional 10 mL ice-cold 10 mM PBS before fat removal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ft20","text":"Place pancreas into preweighed 15 mL tube with 4% PFA (step 3.1). Using analytical balance, record weight of tube containing pancreas to nearest 0.01 g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"da48r","text":"Fix pancreas for   on ice with gentle agitation using a shaker at low speed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40f2m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"D5ED3870524411ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lv1p","text":"Decant fixative and wash pancreas 4 times in approximately 13 mL 0.1 M PBS for  . Tubes should be kept on ice for washes with gentle agitation using a shaker at low speed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8g370","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"048A8250524511ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87bl5","text":"Decant PBS and add approximately 13 mL 30% sucrose. Store   at   to cryoprotect pancreas.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adbdd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"48AFE1F0524511ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4BFFA930524511ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3stnn","text":"Retrieve 15 mL conical tube with pancreas in 30% sucrose (step 11) and pour contents into a 100 mm tissue culture dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7chdt","text":"Using fine forceps, pick up pancreas and blot excess sucrose from tissue using Kimwipes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41kvc","text":"Place the pancreas into the cryomold as shown below, using forceps to gently push the tissue to the bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tirj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coees","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D6F32F3E524511EC95BC0A58A9FEAC02","height":161.34545454545454,"id":190088,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":36,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7qmqr","text":"Orientation of pancreas in cryomold.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IPA-protocols-16.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wkbnyjx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wibnyjx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3wjbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3whbnyjx.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ds7i5","text":"Place cryomold with pancreas onto a layer of dry ice. Fill remaining volume of cryomold with OCT, covering the pancreas, and let freeze thoroughly on dry ice until OCT is opaque.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7i70","text":"Cut cryosections at 5-10 μm thickness and mount to Plus Gold charged slides for staining. For mass quantification, collect cryosections throughout the entire pancreas and to obtain at least 5 sections 200 μm apart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6duma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p613","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3rpj3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":54934,"title":"Immunofluorescent Staining of Mouse Pancreas for Islet Cell Mass Analysis","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eImmunofluorescent Staining of Mouse Pancreas for Islet Cell Mass Analysis\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"immunofluorescent-staining-of-mouse-pancreas-for-i-bzvwp67e","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vibnyjx.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vibnyjx.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Islet and Pancreas Analysis Core","affiliation":"Vanderbilt Diabetes Research Center","affiliation_url":"https://www.vumc.org/vdrc/home","username":"islet-and-pancreas-analysis-core","link":"https://www.vumc.org/vdrc/cores-ipa","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3xebnyjx.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3xebnyjx.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3xdbnyjx.webp"}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":22},"type_id":1,"guid":"0CEA9AA0524711ECBAD01B75804472DC"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18h2l","text":"Wrap frozen cryomold in pre-labeled square of aluminum foil, place into a sealed plastic bag, and store at   until ready to cryosection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"73C08D30524611ECBAD01B75804472DC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}
